intro: Hillia hathewayi, commonly known as the Hatheway's hillia, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires well-drained conditions to thrive. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in moisture retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hillia hathewayi is considered a botanical curiosity and is often sought after by collectors and botanists.
